text: hello friends have you been searching
and searching for really excellent baked
and yet very crispy version of fried
chicken well if it is you've come to the
right place because today I'm sharing
with you a kind of fun version and guess
what the coating is puffed rice cereal
I'm making a marinade right now with a
quart of buttermilk I just added 2
tablespoons and 2 teaspoons of coarse
salt now one teaspoon of black pepper so
you get kind of a spiciness there but
not too overwhelming and one and a half
teaspoons of poultry seasoning whisk
everything till it's combined and then
add three and a half pounds of boneless
skinless chicken pieces we were
attempting to make a nice light recipe
for you so we've removed the skin of a
whole chicken that's cut up even the
wings you can certainly make this recipe
with the skin that you'll get even more
crunch but it'll certainly be more
fattening you're looking to lighten up
you might not want to you want to let
this fit in the marinade for at least
four hours and up to overnight in the
refrigerator I have four cups of puffed
rice cereal I just want to break it down
into crumbs so you can crush it with a
rolling pin in a resealable bag if you
want or pulse it in a food processor you
can leave some pieces a little bit big
for a little extra crunch transfer your
rice cereal crumb to a 9 by 13 baking
dish something flat so they can coat
your chicken and have standing by a
rimmed baking sheet lined with a wire
rack the marinade is going to have to go
it has tons of raw chicken juice in it
not good for you but don't worry it's
done its job of flavoring your chicken
really really nicely remove your chicken
one piece at a time and let most of the
excess buttermilk drip off but you can
leave a little bit on there it's what's
going to make your rice cereal stick
transfer and then coat press to adhere
and then turn again and coat again just
to make sure it gets a really nice
coating on all sides place them on to
the wire rack leaving space between they
shouldn't be touching the great thing
about the rice cereal in here is that
they're already pre crunchy so you
don't need to fry for crunchiness you're
going to have it right off the bat using
the cereal sort of the same thing as
using cornflakes which do the same thing
if you want your chicken to become extra
golden in the end you can pre toast your
rice cereal for about 10 minutes or 15
minutes at 350 or 375 to get them pre
golden aside and then when you take your
chicken out in the end it'll be super
golden have your oven at 425 degrees and
cook your chicken until it's cooked
through and golden brown 35 to 40
minutes crispy crunchy courtesy of
puffed rice cereal look at that and
great for tonight's dinner deep flavor
from the marinade I say that's a winner
what do you say
you
thanks for watching this video be sure
to click here if you want to subscribe
and click over here if you want to
continue watching more great videos like
this
